body.p:
Carlisle, Ky,
March 19, 1861
Hon L. W. Andrews,
My dear Sir,

I promised to remind you of the case of John Kissick, who was convicted at the last term of the Rowan Circuit Court of shooting at Barney Hayden, and fined $21 and imprisoned six months, you heard the testimony, and know that it was a drunken spree, and accompanied with such circumstances as did not indicate malice toward Hayden, He is now in the fourth week of his imprisonment, and I think has been sufficiently punished, and it would be a mercy to relieve him from the balance of the sentence, The fine I suppose has been, or will be paid by his father,

I authorize you to file this letter with
the Govenor as my recomendation of Kissick to his clemency,

Your friend truly,
R. H. Stanton

Senate Chamber
Mar 22d 1861
Hon B. Magoffin

Der Sir At the accomping request of Hon R H Stanton attny for Commwth I cheerfully unite in the recommendation that you Excellency pardon Mr Kessick I am very sure ^he^ has been punished fuly Sufficet. as he has now ben in jail one month and it will be at least a week before a Parden can reach him

Rowan Cir. Ct
$21. & 6 mo imprist=
Jno. Kissick'
